website_summaries.verdict: A solid, affordable rod that is a good option for beginners looking to try out trolling.
pros: Fiberglass construction makes the rod extremely durable for heavy use or rough seas
Single-piece design is easy to set up without worry of collapsing at speed
cons: Lack of 2-piece design makes it difficult to store when not in use

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks medium but,oh boy this thing is a tank,and also weighs like one too but you'll get used to it.For reference of how big and strong this is,the tip of this rod is as thick as the starting end of a 10-20pound rod.
customer_reviews.author: Duy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this rod for my son birthday gift he loves it for big fish heavy action.
customer_reviews.author: PAIMERS

customer_reviews.title: My go-to heavy rod.
customer_reviews.text: I am hard on my fishing equiptment, and for a one piece rod, which I was expecting it to actually be a two piece, it can not be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: keith levi porter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An amazing rod perfect for yellowtail recommended it time and time again
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Good Rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod. Nice and strong. We offshore fish and this has made a nice addition to our arsenal of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G.

customer_reviews.title: Hefty pole
customer_reviews.text: Good strong pole, made to handle the big fish, trolling for lakers.
customer_reviews.author: John R Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Rod seems pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Good buy- seems extra heavy ...not sue about the chrome guides with stainless wire line...we'll see....D. Murray
customer_reviews.author: David S Murray

customer_reviews.title: Heavy ++
customer_reviews.text: Pretty heavy Should probably be Heavy ++. Nice though so I will keep.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busse

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these....
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst balanced rods I've ever see. Awful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable
customer_reviews.text: This rod is no joke. Its definitely for ocean fishing. This isn't for the weak pond or small lake fishing. Its for giant river's and ocean fishing and for fish 50 lbs or under, and maybe a little over 50lbs. Its built to last only a fish with a lot of weight can bend the rod.
customer_reviews.author: V-tastic

customer_reviews.title: Best rod
customer_reviews.text: This rod is strong and durable. i have been catching 20+ lbs fishes and no break or tear and dependable!
customer_reviews.author: Rubo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for a great price. It works fantastic and looks that way also. No reason not to buy this rod!!
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo Cruz

customer_reviews.title: it's a good enough rod but the image is bad
customer_reviews.text: it's a good enough rod but the image is bad. you see it shows a 2 piece rod and what was sent was a one piece rod. i would not have bought this one if it showed a 1 piece rod or if at least it said it was. it's too much trouble to send it back for the price, but i guess that is what the game is.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger B.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It broke the small tip on the top when i use it first time. Now it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Daiwa BFBT70HR Beefstick Salt Water Conventional Rod (7- Feet, Heavy, 20-50 Pounds)
product_meta.description: Daiwa's first spinning reel rolled off the assembly line in 1955. Since then, the company has grown into one of the largest and most influential tackle companies in the world today. To handle sales and distribution in the United States, Daiwa Corporation first opened its doors on September 26, 1966, operating from a small facility in Culver City, California. Today, based in Cypress, California, Daiwa Corporation sells tackle throughout the United States, Canada, Central and South America. From the very beginning, Daiwa's emphasis has been upon innovation and quality. The result is a long list of product features, design and materials that have become standards for the fishing tackle industry. It is a long-standing record of innovation, the type of innovation that has left a visible mark on the majority of tackle manufactured today, innovation that continues to advance the sport of fishing.
feature_bullets: Made using the highest quality components
Custom guide wrap with multi-coat Epoxy finish
Custom guide wrap with multi-coat Epoxy finish
